benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/bundles/{bundleId}/pause - Pause a bundle

covered: Valid Request: Tests cover multiple valid update scenarios (TC01–TC05) with required and optional parameters and headers.
Non-Existing Resource: Tests for non-existent bundle (TC07) and empty database (TC20) returning 404
Concurrency Issues: Tests for concurrent requests (TC21) ensuring only one succeeds.
Authorization/Authentication Boundary: Tests for missing required header (TC10) and unauthorized user (TC11) cover auth boundaries.
gaps: Partial Update: No explicit test confirming PUT either supports or rejects partial updates beyond optional parameters.
Rate Limiting: No tests covering rate limiting or throttling for rapid successive requests.
Caching Behavior: No tests validating caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control) or cache invalidation on state changes.
Forbidden Access: No test for 403 Forbidden due to insufficient permissions (only 401 Unauthorized covered).
Internal Server Error: No test simulating internal server error (500) scenarios.
Performance under load beyond thresholds: While TC22 covers average response time, additional stress tests could be included.
recommendations: Add a test to verify how the API handles rate limiting (e.g., 429 Too Many Requests) under burst load.
Add tests for 403 Forbidden when a user with insufficient permissions attempts to pause a bundle.
Add tests validating caching headers (ETag/Cache-Control) on PUT /pause responses.
Add a test simulating internal server error (500) to ensure proper error handling.
Clarify and implement explicit Partial Update behavior: either add tests to confirm optional fields are accepted as part of a full update or enforce strict update semantics.
